Description: The Adoration of the Virgin by St. Antony and St. Francis; above, the Virgin, seated on a cloud flanked by two angels; below, the two saints kneel upon a parapet; to left, St Antony, with a tau cross, a bell, a book and a hog behind him; to right, St John, holds a cross; beyond, towns visible in a mountainous landscape; an inscription below the saints within a feigned drapery hanging over the parapet Engraving
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (186) (Johannes Stradanus)
Baroni Vannucci 1997 / Jan van der Straet, detto Giovanni Stradano, flandrus pictor et inventor (undescribed)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Representation of: St John of the Cross
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Elizabeth, Duchess of Northumberland
